TITLE.P: UKCCU Support to Implement Spatial Planning Programme in Indonesia

SHORT_DESCR.P: In support of DFID Indonesia’s Operational Plan and as the second phase of spatial plan implementation programmes, DFID is seeking a service provider to deliver its new Reducing Deforestation through Improved Spatial Planning in Papua provinces, Indonesia program. The new programme will be implemented jointly with key Government of Indonesia’s ministries and provinces to establish how the spatial plan implementation can be improved; help Indonesia reduce deforestation, and better recognition of indigenous people (adat) claims and communal management of forest.

The programme will be implemented with national ministries and two provinces of Papua, Indonesia. The programme will: provide highly targeted technical assistance to those in the Indonesian ministries and provincial governments who are committed to improve the spatial plan implementation as tools to reduce deforestation; improve transparency and build constituency in spatial planning at provincial level.

MAIN_SITE.P: Department for International Development, Abercrombie House, East Kilbride, Glasgow, G75 8EA.

SHORT_DESCR.P: In support of DFID Indonesia’s Operational Plan and as the second phase of spatial plan implementation programmes, DFID is seeking a service provider to deliver its new Reducing Deforestation through Improved Spatial Planning in Papua provinces, Indonesia program. The new programme will be implemented jointly with key Government of Indonesia’s ministries and provinces to establish how the spatial plan implementation can be improved; help Indonesia reduce deforestation, and better recognition of indigenous people (adat) claims and communal management of forest.

The programme will be implemented with national ministries and 2 provinces of Papua, Indonesia. The programme will: provide highly targeted technical assistance to those in the Indonesian ministries and provincial governments who are committed to improve the spatial plan implementation as tools to reduce deforestation; improve transparency and build constituency in spatial planning at provincial level; and foster national policy dialogues and engagement to support Papua’s commitment to protect its forests.
The service provider will be expected to implement this program up to March 2022.

INFO_ADD.P: This is a Prior Information Notice only. Publication and call for competition will be conducted once the scope of work is fully defined and approved and the chosen OJEU procurement route determined following consultation with the market at the Early Market Engagement event to be held on 2.5.2018.
Suppliers wishing to register attendance should go to https://www.surveymonkey.co.uk/r/H6GQBTD

There are no separate lots for this programme as the theory of change hinges on the ability of an overall service provider to coordinate the three outputs to create momentum for reform. However, this does not preclude a consortium with a lead service provider.
